prompts.text: Take a photo of their hands today.
What made them smile today? (1 sentence)
Record 3 seconds of the sounds they make right now.
What's a new thing they noticed today?
Take a photo of where they fell asleep.
What's something you're worried about—and something you're proud of?
"Today you smelled like…"
Take a photo of your view while feeding them.
What's a tiny milestone you'd forget by next week?
Say one thing you hope they keep forever.
Take a photo of the mess they made today.
What word/phrase did they say that surprised you?
What did they insist on doing "by myself" today?
Take a photo of their favorite object right now.
What made them laugh the hardest today?
Record them saying a word (or you imitating it).
What did they get stubborn about today? (No judgment—just facts.)
Take a photo of their shoes after a full day.
What's something they're learning to love?
Write a 1-sentence "scene" from today (like a movie shot).
What did they pretend today?
Take a photo of their drawing/creation.
What question did they ask that made you pause?
What did they do that felt very "them"?
Take a photo of their dinner plate (before/after).
What's a new friendship forming?
Record a 5-second "bedtime voice note" to future them.
What are they afraid of lately? What helps?
What's a routine you secretly love?
If today had a title, what would it be?
What did they practice today (even if they complained)?
Take a photo of something they're into this week (book, toy, sport).
What did they say that sounded older than their age?
What's a small kindness you saw them do?
What are they currently obsessed with—and why do you think it clicks?
Record: "One thing I admire about you is…" (10 seconds)
What challenge did they face today and how did they respond?
Take a photo of their backpack / desk / "kid workspace."
What made you proud today (no grades)?
Write a note to their 18-year-old self about who they are right now.
What music are they into right now?
What's a value you hope they learn by watching you?
What's something you disagree about lately—and what's actually underneath it?
Take a photo of a mundane moment you'll miss (car ride, kitchen).
What's a risk they took today (social/creative/academic)?
Write: "Here's what I wish I could explain perfectly…"
Record: "If you ever feel alone, remember…" (10–20 sec)
What's a boundary they set (or needed to set) today?
What's changing in them this year that you want to honor?
Write a thank-you note to them for something specific.
What was the hardest part of today (and how did you get through it)?
Take a photo of their favorite sleep spot.
What song seems to calm them down instantly?
Take a photo of them with a grandparent or loved one.
What's a new sound they made today?
Reflect: "I never thought I would be the kind of parent who..."
Record 10 seconds of tummy time (or them trying to move).
What size clothes are they wearing right now?
Take a photo of their tiny feet.
What made them cry today?
Reflect: What part of your pre-baby life did you miss today?
Take a photo of your view from the rocking chair, bed, or floor.
What made you laugh out loud at them today?
"Today was a [fill in the blank] day."
Take a photo of their hand holding yours.
What's the weirdest thing you Googled today about them?
Record their laugh (or just their breathing) for 10 seconds.
Who do they look like most today?
Take a photo of a mess they made (spit up, toys, etc.).
Write a note to them about how much you love them right now.
What is their favorite toy or object to stare at?
Take a photo of them in the bath.
What time did you wake up today?
"I promise to tell you the story of..."
Take a photo of them being held by someone else.
What’s a nickname you called them today?
If you could freeze time right now, what moment would you pick?
Record yourself talking to them for 15 seconds.
What’s something they did for the first time recently?
Take a photo of their outfit today.
What is their favorite word to say "no" to right now?
Take a photo of them trying to dress themselves.
What’s a "toddler logic" moment that baffled you today?
Record them dancing to their favorite song.
What food did they refuse to eat today (that they liked yesterday)?
Take a photo of their favorite book right now.
What made them have a tantrum today?
Reflect: What is the most testing part of this age for you right now?
What new skill are they working on mastering?
Take a photo of them playing outside.
What did they do that made you feel like they are growing up too fast?
Copy a sentence they said today exactly as they said it.
Take a photo of their "collection" (rocks, sticks, toys).
Who is their best friend (real or imaginary)?
Record them climbing something they shouldn't (or should).
What’s the funniest mispronunciation they have right now?
Take a photo of them sleeping (they look so peaceful!).
What comfort object can they not live without?
Reflect: What quality do they have now that you hope they keep as an adult?
What activity keeps them busy for more than 5 minutes?
Take a photo of what they look like when they are mad.
"I am so proud that you learned to..."
What is their favorite animal sound to make?
Take a photo of you and them making a silly face.
What did you have to negotiate with them about today?
What’s the sweetest thing they did today?
Record them telling you a "story".
What’s a rule they love to break?
Take a photo of their hands doing something (drawing, eating).
Reflect: Write about a moment today where you had to practice extreme patience.
What "why" question did they ask today?
Take a photo of their favorite costume or dress-up outfit.
Who is their "enemy" today (and why)?
Record them explaining how something works.
What did they say that made no sense but was hilarious?
Take a photo of a fort or structure they built.
What are they afraid of in the dark right now?
Reflect: What part of their personality reminds you of yourself?
What did they help you with today?
Take a photo of them with a friend.
What story did they tell you about their day?
"When I grow up, I want to be..."
Take a photo of their bedhead hair in the morning.
What game do they want to play over and over?
Record them singing a song they made up.
What did they get in trouble for today?
Take a photo of them concentrating hard on something.
What is their favorite joke right now?
Reflect: What is a moment today where you felt like a "good parent"?
What show or character are they obsessed with?
Take a photo of a drawing they made for you.
What snack do they ask for constantly?
"I love you because..." (Ask them to finish the sentence).
Take a photo of their shoes (they grow so fast!).
What big word did they use correctly today?
What did they dream about?
Record them answering: "What makes you happy?"
What is a rule they made up for a game?
Take a photo of them hugging a sibling or stuffed animal.
Reflect: Write a note about how their independence is growing.
What did they do today that made you think "they are getting so big"?
Take a photo of their homework or school project.
Who is a friend they talked about today?
Record them explaining the rules of a game they like.
What is a question they asked about the world/news?
"I am good at..." (Ask them to finish the sentence).
Take a photo of their messy room (reality check).
What did they read today?
What made them frustrated with themselves?
Reflect: what is a conversation you had today that you want to remember?
What is their favorite outfit to wear right now?
Take a photo of them doing a chore.
What did they say that hurt your feelings (or someone else's)?
"My favorite thing to do with you is..." (Ask them).
Record them telling a joke.
What do they want to buy with their own money?
Take a photo of them playing a sport or active game.
What is a fear they conquered (or faced) recently?
What did they create today (Lego, art, code)?
Reflect: What is a parenting challenge you are facing with them right now?
What is their favorite subject in school right now?
"I wish I could..." (Ask them).
Take a photo of them eating their favorite meal.
What is a "big kid" privilege they earned or want?
Who is their role model right now?
Record them practicing a skill (instrument, sport, etc.).
What made them laugh uncontrollably today?
What did they do to help around the house?
Take a photo of them with their siblings/cousins.
Reflect: Write a note about a trait of theirs you admire.
What song text did you overhear them singing?
Take a photo of their "outfit of the day".
What is something they know more about than you do?
Record a 10-second interview: "What's the best thing about being your age?"
What did they complain about today (and was it valid)?
Reflect: What quality of theirs do you hope they never lose?
What new slang word did they use?
Take a photo of them doing homework or studying.
What is a boundary they are pushing against?
"I am so glad you..." (Tell them).
What movie do they want to see?
Take a photo of them with their team/group/club.
What world event did they ask about?
What is something they did that showed maturity?
Record them explaining a meme to you.
What did you argue about today? (Be honest).
Take a photo of their favorite gadget/device.
What is their "dream job" this week?
Reflect: What is the hardest part of letting them grow up right now?
What did they cook or make for themselves?
Who is a celebrity they admire?
Take a photo of them in their "natural habitat" (room/couch).
What advice did they give you (seriously or jokingly)?
"You are really good at..." (Observe them).
Record them laughing with friends.
What is a secret they told you?
Take a photo of something they borrowed from you.
What are they saving up for?
What did they forget to do today?
Reflect: Write a letter to them for their high school graduation day.
